Operations Assistant job at EHA Clinics




        
    

        
        EHA Clinics, a subsidiary of eHealth Africa, is a health care network operating across Nigeria that provides high-quality, innovative, data-driven, and technology-enabled services. EHA Clinics delivers a comprehensive range of state of the art health care services in each location, e.g,  general consultations, laboratory investigations, pharmaceuticals, annual medical checks, child wellness checks, ultrasonography, and specialized services (urgent care, telemedicine, home care, dental care, and ophthalmology).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Assistant

Job Location: Abuja
Department: Operations
Reports to: Clinical Operations Manager
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Mission Objective 


	Clinical services operations department is responsible for the smooth running of the clinics, by providing support to the medical team to ensure the delivery of quality healthcare.
	The operations assistant manages appointment schedules for both the patient and doctor ensuring that patient wait times are kept at the minimum.
	They also provide information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiries as well as handling patient billing.


Duties and Responsibilities
Purpose:    


	Prepare monthly standard accounting submissions to the Management, for review by the Financial Controller, including general ledger files, account reconciliations, as well as other financial information in a timely and accurate manner
	Gathering and validating supporting documents for payments Assist in preparing month end schedules Prepare bank reconciliations for all bank accounts including Flutter-wave collections Transaction postings/bookkeeping (payments, receipts, expenses, accruals, etc.)
	Management of Petty cash and Cash advance retirement Support in tracking revenue and record/reconcile in correct categories Tracking organization expenses Processing refunds Enter all relevant data into accounting software.


Engagement:


	Management of Petty cash and Cash advance retirement Support in tracking revenue and record/reconcile in correct categories.


Delivery:


	Assist in preparing month end schedules Enter all relevant data into accounting software
	Prepare monthly standard accounting submissions to the Management, for review by the Financial Controller, including general ledger files, account reconciliations, as well as other financial information in a timely and accurate manner.


Targeted Specialized Knowledge


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management & Technology, Public Administration, Secretarial Studies, or any management-related field.
	Minimum of one year experience handling roles as a Personal Assistant, Front Desk Executive, and Customer Service in any reputable company.

  "description": "TeamAce Limited - Our client, a reputable company in the commercial kitchen equipment and industrial services sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Admin
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Sales Admin, you will provide administrative and operational support to the Managing Director and the sales team.
	You will handle documentation, prepare reports, manage client correspondence, and ensure smooth coordination between sales, store, and manufacturing units.
	Your role is critical to maintaining accurate records and supporting efficient sales operations.


Responsibilities


	Manage sales documentation, including filing, creating client files, and attaching waybills to invoices
	Prepare sales quotations, daily collection reports, sales waybills, and weekly/monthly sales reports
	Monitor client emails, respond promptly, and follow up on order progress with relevant departments
	Coordinate manufacturing orders and ensure waybills are signed and processed correctly
	Manage office items (e.g., stationery) and support cheque receipt preparation and documentation for the MD.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field
	2 &ndash; 4 years of experience in sales administration or sales support, preferably in an industrial or manufacturing environment
	Strong organizational and documentation skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)
	Excellent communication, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.

Sales Admin Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited - Our client, a reputable company in the commercial kitchen equipment and industrial services sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Admin
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As the Sales Admin, you will provide administrative and operational support to the Managing Director and the sales team.
	You will handle documentation, prepare reports, manage client correspondence, and ensure smooth coordination between sales, store, and manufacturing units.
	Your role is critical to maintaining accurate records and supporting efficient sales operations.


Responsibilities


	Manage sales documentation, including filing, creating client files, and attaching waybills to invoices
	Prepare sales quotations, daily collection reports, sales waybills, and weekly/monthly sales reports
	Monitor client emails, respond promptly, and follow up on order progress with relevant departments
	Coordinate manufacturing orders and ensure waybills are signed and processed correctly
	Manage office items (e.g., stationery) and support cheque receipt preparation and documentation for the MD.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field
	2 – 4 years of experience in sales administration or sales support, preferably in an industrial or manufacturing environment
	Strong organizational and documentation skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)
	Excellent communication, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
